BatchGetCaseRule.name: BatchGetCaseRule
BatchGetCaseRule.documentation: Gets a batch of case rules. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

BatchGetField.name: BatchGetField
BatchGetField.documentation: Returns the description for the list of fields in the request parameters.

BatchPutFieldOptions.name: BatchPutFieldOptions
BatchPutFieldOptions.documentation: Creates and updates a set of field options for a single select field in a Cases domain.

CreateCase.name: CreateCase
CreateCase.documentation:
If you provide a value for PerformedBy.UserArn you must also have connect:DescribeUser permission on the User ARN resource that you provide

Creates a case in the specified Cases domain. Case system and custom fields are taken as an array id/value pairs with a declared data types.

The following fields are required when creating a case:

  • customer_id - You must provide the full customer profile ARN in this format: arn:aws:profile:your_AWS_Region:your_AWS_account ID:domains/your_profiles_domain_name/profiles/profile_ID

  • title

CreateCaseRule.name: CreateCaseRule
CreateCaseRule.documentation: Creates a new case rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

CreateDomain.name: CreateDomain
CreateDomain.documentation:
Creates a domain, which is a container for all case data, such as cases, fields, templates and layouts. Each Amazon Connect instance can be associated with only one Cases domain.

This will not associate your connect instance to Cases domain. Instead, use the Amazon Connect CreateIntegrationAssociation API. You need specific IAM permissions to successfully associate the Cases domain. For more information, see Onboard to Cases.

CreateField.name: CreateField
CreateField.documentation: Creates a field in the Cases domain. This field is used to define the case object model (that is, defines what data can be captured on cases) in a Cases domain.

CreateLayout.name: CreateLayout
CreateLayout.documentation:
Creates a layout in the Cases domain. Layouts define the following configuration in the top section and More Info tab of the Cases user interface:

  • Fields to display to the users

  • Field ordering

Title and Status fields cannot be part of layouts since they are not configurable.

CreateRelatedItem.name: CreateRelatedItem
CreateRelatedItem.documentation:
Creates a related item (comments, tasks, and contacts) and associates it with a case.

  • A Related Item is a resource that is associated with a case. It may or may not have an external identifier linking it to an external resource (for example, a contactArn). All Related Items have their own internal identifier, the relatedItemArn. Examples of related items include comments and contacts.

  • If you provide a value for performedBy.userArn you must also have DescribeUser permission on the ARN of the user that you provide.

  • The type field is reserved for internal use only.

CreateTemplate.name: CreateTemplate
CreateTemplate.documentation:
Creates a template in the Cases domain. This template is used to define the case object model (that is, to define what data can be captured on cases) in a Cases domain. A template must have a unique name within a domain, and it must reference existing field IDs and layout IDs. Additionally, multiple fields with same IDs are not allowed within the same Template. A template can be either Active or Inactive, as indicated by its status. Inactive templates cannot be used to create cases.

Other template APIs are:

  • DeleteTemplate

  • GetTemplate

  • ListTemplates

  • UpdateTemplate

DeleteCase.name: DeleteCase
DeleteCase.documentation:
The DeleteCase API permanently deletes a case and all its associated resources from the cases data store. After a successful deletion, you cannot:

  • Retrieve related items

  • Access audit history

  • Perform any operations that require the CaseID

This action is irreversible. Once you delete a case, you cannot recover its data.

DeleteCaseRule.name: DeleteCaseRule
DeleteCaseRule.documentation: Deletes a case rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

DeleteDomain.name: DeleteDomain
DeleteDomain.documentation:
Deletes a Cases domain.

After deleting your domain you must disassociate the deleted domain from your Amazon Connect instance with another API call before being able to use Cases again with this Amazon Connect instance. See DeleteIntegrationAssociation.

DeleteField.name: DeleteField
DeleteField.documentation:
Deletes a field from a cases template. You can delete up to 100 fields per domain.

After a field is deleted:

  • You can still retrieve the field by calling BatchGetField.

  • You cannot update a deleted field by calling UpdateField; it throws a ValidationException.

  • Deleted fields are not included in the ListFields response.

  • Calling CreateCase with a deleted field throws a ValidationException denoting which field IDs in the request have been deleted.

  • Calling GetCase with a deleted field ID returns the deleted field's value if one exists.

  • Calling UpdateCase with a deleted field ID throws a ValidationException if the case does not already contain a value for the deleted field. Otherwise it succeeds, allowing you to update or remove (using emptyValue: {}) the field's value from the case.

  • GetTemplate does not return field IDs for deleted fields.

  • GetLayout does not return field IDs for deleted fields.

  • Calling SearchCases with the deleted field ID as a filter returns any cases that have a value for the deleted field that matches the filter criteria.

  • Calling SearchCases with a searchTerm value that matches a deleted field's value on a case returns the case in the response.

  • Calling BatchPutFieldOptions with a deleted field ID throw a ValidationException.

  • Calling GetCaseEventConfiguration does not return field IDs for deleted fields.

DeleteLayout.name: DeleteLayout
DeleteLayout.documentation:
Deletes a layout from a cases template. You can delete up to 100 layouts per domain.

After a layout is deleted:

  • You can still retrieve the layout by calling GetLayout.

  • You cannot update a deleted layout by calling UpdateLayout; it throws a ValidationException.

  • Deleted layouts are not included in the ListLayouts response.

DeleteRelatedItem.name: DeleteRelatedItem
DeleteRelatedItem.documentation:
Deletes the related item resource under a case.

This API cannot be used on a FILE type related attachment. To delete this type of file, use the DeleteAttachedFile API

DeleteTemplate.name: DeleteTemplate
DeleteTemplate.documentation:
Deletes a cases template. You can delete up to 100 templates per domain.

After a cases template is deleted:

  • You can still retrieve the template by calling GetTemplate.

  • You cannot update the template.

  • You cannot create a case by using the deleted template.

  • Deleted templates are not included in the ListTemplates response.

GetCase.name: GetCase
GetCase.documentation: Returns information about a specific case if it exists.

GetCaseAuditEvents.name: GetCaseAuditEvents
GetCaseAuditEvents.documentation: Returns the audit history about a specific case if it exists.

GetDomain.name: GetDomain
GetDomain.documentation: Returns information about a specific domain if it exists.

GetLayout.name: GetLayout
GetLayout.documentation: Returns the details for the requested layout.

GetTemplate.name: GetTemplate
GetTemplate.documentation:
Returns the details for the requested template. Other template APIs are:

  • CreateTemplate

  • DeleteTemplate

  • ListTemplates

  • UpdateTemplate

ListCaseRules.name: ListCaseRules
ListCaseRules.documentation: Lists all case rules in a Cases domain. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

ListDomains.name: ListDomains
ListDomains.documentation: Lists all cases domains in the Amazon Web Services account. Each list item is a condensed summary object of the domain.

ListFieldOptions.name: ListFieldOptions
ListFieldOptions.documentation: Lists all of the field options for a field identifier in the domain.

ListFields.name: ListFields
ListFields.documentation: Lists all fields in a Cases domain.

ListLayouts.name: ListLayouts
ListLayouts.documentation: Lists all layouts in the given cases domain. Each list item is a condensed summary object of the layout.

ListTemplates.name: ListTemplates
ListTemplates.documentation:
Lists all of the templates in a Cases domain. Each list item is a condensed summary object of the template.

Other template APIs are:

  • CreateTemplate

  • DeleteTemplate

  • GetTemplate

  • UpdateTemplate

PutCaseEventConfiguration.name: PutCaseEventConfiguration
PutCaseEventConfiguration.documentation: Adds case event publishing configuration. For a complete list of fields you can add to the event message, see Create case fields in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide

SearchCases.name: SearchCases
SearchCases.documentation:
Searches for cases within their associated Cases domain. Search results are returned as a paginated list of abridged case documents.

For customer_id you must provide the full customer profile ARN in this format: arn:aws:profile:your AWS Region:your AWS account ID:domains/profiles domain name/profiles/profile ID.

SearchRelatedItems.name: SearchRelatedItems
SearchRelatedItems.documentation:
Searches for related items that are associated with a case.

If no filters are provided, this returns all related items associated with a case.

UpdateCase.name: UpdateCase
UpdateCase.documentation:
If you provide a value for PerformedBy.UserArn you must also have connect:DescribeUser permission on the User ARN resource that you provide

Updates the values of fields on a case. Fields to be updated are received as an array of id/value pairs identical to the CreateCase input .

If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body.

UpdateCaseRule.name: UpdateCaseRule
UpdateCaseRule.documentation: Updates a case rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

UpdateField.name: UpdateField
UpdateField.documentation: Updates the properties of an existing field.

UpdateLayout.name: UpdateLayout
UpdateLayout.documentation:
Updates the attributes of an existing layout.

If the action is successful, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body.

A ValidationException is returned when you add non-existent fieldIds to a layout.

Title and Status fields cannot be part of layouts because they are not configurable.

UpdateTemplate.name: UpdateTemplate
UpdateTemplate.documentation:
Updates the attributes of an existing template. The template attributes that can be modified include name, description, layoutConfiguration, requiredFields, and status. At least one of these attributes must not be null. If a null value is provided for a given attribute, that attribute is ignored and its current value is preserved.

Other template APIs are:

  • CreateTemplate

  • DeleteTemplate

  • GetTemplate

  • ListTemplates

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

eventId.documentation: Unique identifier of a case audit history event.

fields.documentation: A list of Case Audit History event fields.

performedBy.documentation: Information of the user which performed the audit.

performedTime.documentation: Time at which an Audit History event took place.

type.documentation: The Type of an audit history event.

AuditEvent.documentation: Represents the content of a particular audit event.

eventFieldId.documentation: Unique identifier of field in an Audit History entry.

booleanValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a Boolean value type. Only one value can be provided.

doubleValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a Double value type. Only one value can be provided.

stringValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a String value type. Only one value can be provided.

userArnValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a String value type formatted as an ARN. Only one value can be provided.

AuditEventFieldValueUnion.documentation: Object to store union of Field values.

AuditEventPerformedBy.documentation: Information of the user which performed the audit.

moreInfo.documentation: This represents sections in a tab of the page layout.

topPanel.documentation: This represents sections in a panel of the page layout.

BasicLayout.documentation: Content specific to BasicLayout type. It configures fields in the top panel and More Info tab of agent application.

domainId.documentation: Unique identifier of a Cases domain.
The unique identifier of the Cases domain.
The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

equalTo.documentation: Tests that operandOne is equal to operandTwo.

notEqualTo.documentation: Tests that operandOne is not equal to operandTwo.

BooleanCondition.documentation: Boolean condition for a rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

operandOne.documentation: Represents the left hand operand in the condition.

operandTwo.documentation: Represents the right hand operand in the condition.

result.documentation: The value of the outer rule if the condition evaluates to true.

BooleanOperands.documentation: Boolean operands for a condition. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

CaseEventIncludedData.documentation: Details of what case data is published through the case event stream.

field.documentation: A list of fields to filter on.

CaseFilter.documentation: A filter for cases. Only one value can be provided.

required.documentation: Required rule type, used to indicate whether a field is required.

CaseRuleDetails.documentation: Represents what rule type should take place, under what conditions. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

errorCode.documentation: Error code from getting a case rule.

id.documentation: The case rule identifier that caused the error.

message.documentation: Error message from getting a case rule.

CaseRuleError.documentation: Error for batch describe case rules API failure. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

caseRuleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the case rule.

CaseRuleSummary.documentation: Summary information of this case rule. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

body.documentation: Text in the body of a Comment on a case.

contentType.documentation: Type of the text in the box of a Comment on a case.

CommentContent.documentation: Represents the content of a Comment to be returned to agents.

CommentFilter.documentation: A filter for related items of type Comment.

ConflictException.documentation: The requested operation would cause a conflict with the current state of a service resource associated with the request. Resolve the conflict before retrying this request. See the accompanying error message for details.

contactArn.documentation: A unique identifier of a contact in Amazon Connect.

Contact.documentation: An object that represents an Amazon Connect contact object.

channel.documentation: A list of channels to filter on for related items of type Contact.

connectedToSystemTime.documentation: The difference between the InitiationTimestamp and the DisconnectTimestamp of the contact.

contactArn.documentation: A unique identifier of a contact in Amazon Connect.

ContactContent.documentation: An object that represents a content of an Amazon Connect contact object.

channel.documentation: A list of channels to filter on for related items of type Contact.

contactArn.documentation: A unique identifier of a contact in Amazon Connect.

ContactFilter.documentation: A filter for related items of type Contact.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If not provided, the Amazon Web Services SDK populates this field. For more information about idempotency, see Making retries safe with idempotent APIs.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

fields.documentation: An array of objects with field ID (matching ListFields/DescribeField) and value union data.

caseArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the case.

domainId.documentation: Unique identifier of a Cases domain.

rule.documentation: Represents what rule type should take place, under what conditions.

caseRuleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a case rule.

name.documentation: The name for your Cases domain. It must be unique for your Amazon Web Services account.

domainArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Cases domain.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.
The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

type.documentation: Defines the data type, some system constraints, and default display of the field.

fieldArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the field.

content.documentation: Information about which fields will be present in the layout, and information about the order of the fields.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

name.documentation: The name of the layout. It must be unique for the Cases domain.

layoutArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created layout.

content.documentation: The content of a related item to be created.

performedBy.documentation: Represents the creator of the related item.

relatedItemArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the related item.

relatedItemId.documentation: The unique identifier of the related item.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

layoutConfiguration.documentation: Configuration of layouts associated to the template.

name.documentation: A name for the template. It must be unique per domain.

requiredFields.documentation: A list of fields that must contain a value for a case to be successfully created with this template.

rules.documentation: A list of case rules (also known as case field conditions) on a template.

templateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the newly created template.

domainId.documentation: A unique identifier of the Cases domain.

DomainSummary.documentation: Object for the summarized details of the domain.

EmptyFieldValue.documentation:
An empty value. You cannot set EmptyFieldValue on a field that is required on a case template.

This structure will never have any data members. It signifies an empty value on a case field.

EmptyOperandValue.documentation: Represents an empty operand value. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

enabled.documentation: Indicates whether the to broadcast case event data to the customer.

includedData.documentation: Details of what case and related item data is published through the case event stream.

EventBridgeConfiguration.documentation: Configuration to enable EventBridge case event delivery and determine what data is delivered.

caseData.documentation: Details of what case data is published through the case event stream.

relatedItemData.documentation: Details of what related item data is published through the case event stream.

EventIncludedData.documentation: Details of what case and related item data is published through the case event stream.

errorCode.documentation: The error code from getting a field.

id.documentation: The field identifier that caused the error.

message.documentation: The error message from getting a field.

contains.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

equalTo.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

greaterThan.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

greaterThanOrEqualTo.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

lessThan.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

lessThanOrEqualTo.documentation: Object containing field identifier and value information.

FieldFilter.documentation: A filter for fields. Only one value can be provided.

fields.documentation: Represents an ordered list containing field related information.

FieldGroup.documentation: Object for a group of fields and associated properties.

FieldIdentifier.documentation: Object for unique identifier of a field.

active.documentation: Describes whether the FieldOption is active (displayed) or inactive.

name.documentation: FieldOptionName has max length 100 and disallows trailing spaces.

value.documentation: FieldOptionValue has max length 100 and must be alphanumeric with hyphens and underscores.

errorCode.documentation: Error code from creating or updating field option.

message.documentation: Error message from creating or updating field option.

value.documentation: The field option value that caused the error.

fieldArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the field.

FieldSummary.documentation: Object for the summarized details of the field.

booleanValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a Boolean value type. Only one value can be provided.

doubleValue.documentation: Can be either null, or have a Double number value type. Only one value can be provided.

userArnValue.documentation: Represents the user that performed the audit.

FieldValueUnion.documentation:
Object to store union of Field values.

The Summary system field accepts 3000 characters while all other fields accept 500 characters.

fileArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a File in Amazon Connect.

FileContent.documentation: An object that represents a content of an Amazon Connect file object.

fileArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the file.

FileFilter.documentation: A filter for related items of type File.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of audit events to return. The current maximum supported value is 25. This is also the default when no other value is provided.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.

auditEvents.documentation: A list of case audits where each represents a particular edit of the case.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. This is null if there are no more results to return.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

eventBridge.documentation: Configuration to enable EventBridge case event delivery and determine what data is delivered.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Timestamp when the resource was created or last modified.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: Advice to clients on when the call can be safely retried.

InternalServerException.documentation: We couldn't process your request because of an issue with the server. Try again later.

LayoutConfiguration.documentation: Object to store configuration of layouts associated to the template.

basic.documentation: Content specific to BasicLayout type. It configures fields in the top panel and More Info tab of Cases user interface.

LayoutContent.documentation: Object to store union of different versions of layout content.

LayoutSections.documentation: Ordered list containing different kinds of sections that can be added. A LayoutSections object can only contain one section.

fieldId.documentation: The field ID that this operand should take the value of.

OperandOne.documentation: Represents the left hand operand in the condition. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

OperandTwo.documentation: Represents the right hand operand in the condition. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

eventBridge.documentation: Configuration to enable EventBridge case event delivery and determine what data is delivered.

comment.documentation: Represents the content of a comment to be returned to agents.

contact.documentation: Represents the content of a contact to be returned to agents.

file.documentation: Represents the content of a File to be returned to agents.

sla.documentation: Represents the content of an SLA to be returned to agents.

RelatedItemContent.documentation: Represents the content of a particular type of related item.

includeContent.documentation: Details of what related item data is published through the case event stream.

RelatedItemEventIncludedData.documentation: Details of what related item data is published through the case event stream.

comment.documentation: Represents the content of a comment to be returned to agents.

contact.documentation: Object representing a contact in Amazon Connect as an API request field.

sla.documentation: Represents the content of an SLA to be created.

RelatedItemInputContent.documentation: Represents the content of a related item to be created.

comment.documentation: A filter for related items of type Comment.

contact.documentation: A filter for related items of type Contact.

file.documentation: A filter for related items of this type of File.

sla.documentation: Filter for related items of type SLA.

RelatedItemTypeFilter.documentation: The list of types of related items and their parameters to use for filtering.

conditions.documentation: List of conditions for the required rule; the first condition to evaluate to true dictates the value of the rule.

defaultValue.documentation: The value of the rule (that is, whether the field is required) should none of the conditions evaluate to true.

RequiredCaseRule.documentation: Required rule type, used to indicate whether a field is required. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

RequiredField.documentation: List of fields that must have a value provided to create a case.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: We couldn't find the requested resource. Check that your resources exists and were created in the same Amazon Web Services Region as your request, and try your request again.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

fields.documentation: The list of field identifiers to be returned as part of the response.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of cases to return. The current maximum supported value is 25. This is also the default value when no other value is provided.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.

searchTerm.documentation: A word or phrase used to perform a quick search.

sorts.documentation: A list of sorts where each sort specifies a field and their sort order to be applied to the results.

cases.documentation: A list of case documents where each case contains the properties CaseId and Fields where each field is a complex union structure.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. This is null if there are no more results to return.

tags.documentation: A map of of key-value pairs that represent tags on a resource. Tags are used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

SearchCasesResponseItem.documentation: A list of items that represent cases.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

filters.documentation: The list of types of related items and their parameters to use for filtering.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return per page.

nextToken.documentation: The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.
The token for the next set of results. This is null if there are no more results to return.

relatedItems.documentation: A list of items related to a case.

associationTime.documentation: Time at which a related item was associated with a case.

content.documentation: Represents the content of a particular type of related item.

performedBy.documentation: Represents the creator of the related item.

tags.documentation: A map of of key-value pairs that represent tags on a resource. Tags are used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

SearchRelatedItemsResponseItem.documentation: A list of items that represent RelatedItems.

fieldGroup.documentation: Consists of a group of fields and associated properties.

Section.documentation: This represents a sections within a panel or tab of the page layout.

SectionsList.documentation: Ordered list containing different kinds of sections that can be added.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The service quota has been exceeded. For a list of service quotas, see Amazon Connect Service Quotas in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.

completionTime.documentation: Time at which an SLA was completed.

targetFieldValues.documentation: Represents a list of target field values for the fieldId specified in SlaConfiguration.

targetTime.documentation: Target time by which an SLA should be completed.

SlaContent.documentation: Represents the content of an SLA to be returned to agents.

SlaFilter.documentation: A filter for related items of type SLA.

targetFieldValues.documentation: Represents a list of target field values for the fieldId specified in SlaInputConfiguration. The SLA is considered met if any one of these target field values matches the actual field value.

targetSlaMinutes.documentation: Target duration in minutes within which an SLA should be completed.

SlaInputConfiguration.documentation: Represents the input configuration of an SLA being created.

tags.documentation: A map of of key-value pairs that represent tags on a resource. Tags are used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

TemplateRule.documentation: An association representing a case rule acting upon a field. In the Amazon Connect admin website, case rules are known as case field conditions. For more information about case field conditions, see Add case field conditions to a case template.

templateArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The rate has been exceeded for this API. Please try again after a few minutes.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

fields.documentation: An array of objects with fieldId (matching ListFields/DescribeField) and value union data, structured identical to CreateCase.

domainId.documentation: Unique identifier of a Cases domain.

rule.documentation: Represents what rule type should take place, under what conditions.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

content.documentation: Information about which fields will be present in the layout, the order of the fields.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

name.documentation: The name of the layout. It must be unique per domain.

domainId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Cases domain.

layoutConfiguration.documentation: Configuration of layouts associated to the template.

name.documentation: The name of the template. It must be unique per domain.

requiredFields.documentation: A list of fields that must contain a value for a case to be successfully created with this template.

rules.documentation: A list of case rules (also known as case field conditions) on a template.

userArn.documentation: Represents the Amazon Connect ARN of the user.

UserUnion.documentation: Represents the entity that performed the action.

ValidationException.documentation: The request isn't valid. Check the syntax and try again.

documentation:
• Cases actions

  • Cases data types

With Amazon Connect Cases, your agents can track and manage customer issues that require multiple interactions, follow-up tasks, and teams in your contact center. A case represents a customer issue. It records the issue, the steps and interactions taken to resolve the issue, and the outcome. For more information, see Amazon Connect Cases in the Amazon Connect Administrator Guide.
